Multinomial regression based on phreg regression

Source: R/mutinomialreg.R
mlogit.Rd

Fits multinomial regression model $$ P_i = \frac{ \exp( X^\beta_i ) }{ \sum_{j=1}^K \exp( X^\beta_j ) }$$ for $$i=1,..,K$$ where $$\beta_1 = 0$$, such that $$\sum_j P_j = 1$$ using phreg function. Thefore the ratio $$\frac{P_i}{P_1} = \exp( X^\beta_i )$$

mlogit(formula, data, offset = NULL, weights = NULL, ...)

Arguments

formula

formula with outcome (see coxph)
data

data frame
offset

offsets for partial likelihood
weights

for score equations
...

Additional arguments to lower level funtions

Details

Coefficients give log-Relative-Risk relative to baseline group (first level of factor, so that it can reset by relevel command). Standard errors computed based on sandwhich form $$ DU^-1 \sum U_i^2 DU^-1$$.

Can also get influence functions (possibly robust) via iid() function, response should be a factor.

Author

Thomas Scheike

Examples


data(bmt)
dfactor(bmt) <- cause1f~cause
drelevel(bmt,ref=3) <- cause3f~cause
dlevels(bmt)

#> cause1f #levels=:3 
#> [1] "0" "1" "2"
#> -----------------------------------------
#> cause3f #levels=:3 
#> [1] "2" "0" "1"
#> -----------------------------------------

mreg <- mlogit(cause1f~tcell+platelet,bmt)
summary(mreg)

#> 
#>     n events
#>  1224    408
#> 
#>  408 clusters
#> log-coeffients:
#>               Estimate     S.E.  dU^-1/2 P-value
#> XX(Intercept)  0.25002  0.13906  0.13858  0.0722
#> XXtcell       -0.28389  0.36431  0.36285  0.4358
#> XXplatelet    -0.68611  0.24797  0.24956  0.0057
#> XX(Intercept) -0.56565  0.16921  0.17078  0.0008
#> XXtcell        0.50505  0.36481  0.36226  0.1662
#> XXplatelet    -0.35890  0.29130  0.28727  0.2179
#> 
#> exp(coeffients):
#>                 Estimate  Std.Err     2.5%    97.5% P-value
#> [XX(Intercept)] 1.284056 0.178555 0.934095 1.634018  0.1116
#> [XXtcell]       0.752850 0.274272 0.215286 1.290414  0.3675
#> [XXplatelet]    0.503530 0.124863 0.258804 0.748256  0.0001
#> [XX(Intercept)] 0.567990 0.096112 0.379615 0.756366  0.0000
#> [XXtcell]       1.657072 0.604514 0.472246 2.841899  0.2771
#> [XXplatelet]    0.698444 0.203458 0.299674 1.097214  0.1383
#> 

mreg3 <- mlogit(cause3f~tcell+platelet,bmt)
summary(mreg3)

#> 
#>     n events
#>  1224    408
#> 
#>  408 clusters
#> log-coeffients:
#>               Estimate     S.E.  dU^-1/2 P-value
#> XX(Intercept)  0.56565  0.16921  0.17078  0.0008
#> XXtcell       -0.50505  0.36481  0.36226  0.1662
#> XXplatelet     0.35890  0.29130  0.28727  0.2179
#> XX(Intercept)  0.81567  0.16346  0.16467  0.0000
#> XXtcell       -0.78894  0.39244  0.38890  0.0444
#> XXplatelet    -0.32721  0.30423  0.30139  0.2821
#> 
#> exp(coeffients):
#>                 Estimate Std.Err    2.5%   97.5% P-value
#> [XX(Intercept)]  1.76059 0.29792 1.17669 2.34450  0.0107
#> [XXtcell]        0.60347 0.22015 0.17198 1.03497  0.0717
#> [XXplatelet]     1.43175 0.41707 0.61431 2.24920  0.3006
#> [XX(Intercept)]  2.26070 0.36953 1.53644 2.98496  0.0006
#> [XXtcell]        0.45433 0.17829 0.10488 0.80378  0.0022
#> [XXplatelet]     0.72093 0.21933 0.29106 1.15080  0.2032
#> 

## inverse information standard errors 
estimate(coef=mreg3$coef,vcov=mreg3$II)

#>                 Estimate Std.Err    2.5%    97.5%   P-value
#> XX(Intercept)     0.5657  0.1708  0.2309  0.90038 9.259e-04
#> XXtcell          -0.5051  0.3623 -1.2151  0.20497 1.633e-01
#> XXplatelet        0.3589  0.2873 -0.2041  0.92194 2.115e-01
#> XX(Intercept).1   0.8157  0.1647  0.4929  1.13842 7.294e-07
#> XXtcell.1        -0.7889  0.3889 -1.5512 -0.02672 4.249e-02
#> XXplatelet.1     -0.3272  0.3014 -0.9179  0.26350 2.776e-01
